<RESUME_START>
ACCOUNTANT III
Senior Accountant
Results oriented accounting professional with
17+ years of progressive experience in a board range of accounting
functions.
Successful at managing multiple projects while consistently exceeding deadlines.
Proven self-starter with strong managerial relationship and team building skills.
Proactive strategic thinker with strong analytical, organizational and  communication
skills.
Areas of Expertise
Accounts Payable
Fixed Asset and Property Accounts Receivable Payroll
Month-End Closing
Reconciliation and Analysis General Ledger Entries
Budgeting Contract Management Board Of Directors Reporting Staff Management ​Expense Reporting Settlement Payments
Vendor Relations

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Project lead for the automation and implementation of employee expense and vendor self service modules.
Authored and established departmental check printing and ACH standard operating procedures.
Streamlined operations and eliminated one full day from month-end  closing by condensing and automating vendor project retention funds.
Automated Positive Pay and ACH notifications for faster and more reliable response time.
Project Co-lead for Oracle Payroll implementation.
Created and Implemented an employee morale initiative 'Where Everybody Counts" for the Office of Accounting.
Managed employee benevolent fund for 13 years as Secretary for the MARTA Employees Club.
Streamlined the process in which employees seek assistance and funds distributed.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE


08/2007 to Current
Accountant III
Company Name
— City , State
Team Lead for three Accounting Specialist.  Oversees accounts payable functionality while managing daily workflow duties.
Executes check printing and ACH direct deposits for AP, payroll third party and risk management vendors and employees.
​Initiates positive pay file, stop payments and void file transfers to financial institution.
Capitalizes operating and project expenses according to policy.
Monitors fixed asset subledger for accuracy.
Reconciles fixed asset subledger to the general ledger control account for each class of fixed assets and resolves any reconciling items monthly.
Codes/reclass invoices for fixed asset purchases with the appropriate general ledger account number, business unit or cost center.
Audits invoices prior to payment for accuracy and compliance in accordance with accounting and Authority guidelines and statue.
Responsible for over fifty high volume contracts, ensuring accuracy and compliance with contracts terms, GAAP and authority procedures.
Manages $1M contract retainage and reconcile variances on a monthly basis.
Manages $5M operating accruals account.
Post monthly to the general ledger.
Reconciles financial data for the purpose of maintaining accurate account balances and ensuring compliance with established accounting procedure.
Monitors account balances and related financial activity to ensure that allocations are accurate and comply with established financial practices.
Verify appropriate approvals of invoices, investigate and resolve issues.
Trains staff and/or outside vendors regarding procedural requirements for transaction processing.
Collaborates with project managers, purchasing agents, contract administrators and accounting specialist regarding procedural requirements for the purpose of processing transactions.
Researches discrepancies of financial information and/or documentation to for the purpose of ensuring the accuracy and adhering to established procedures prior to processing.

04/1999 to 08/2007
Credit / Collections Analyst
Company Name
— City , State
Co-managed the Authority's short-term operational investment portfolios and intermediate-term reserve investment portfolios, totaling $300 million.
Completed daily cash management activities such as setting the daily cash position, funds movement and the investment of excess funds.
Prepared a rolling forecast of cash receipts and expenditures, encompassing in excess of $700 million annually.
Initiated all wire fund transfers and manages transfer database.
Reviewed, analyzed and managed MARTA's credit policy to ensure the effectiveness of credit terms and credit granting practices.
Monitored, controlled and measured performance of the accounts receivable and its aging schedule for compliance with payment standards to minimize past due accounts.
Liaison between financial institution and the Office of Corporate Finance to determine and resolve any variances with regard to financial reports.

12/1996 to 04/1999
Accounting Coordinator
Company Name
— City , State
Reconciled monthly bank statements to Spectrum Accounting and manual checkbook.
Monitored accounts detecting fraudulent activities and common bank errors.
Handled all accounts receivables, posted cash to appropriate accounts, prepared deposits and recorded transactions into the general journal.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Accountant

Location: Minneapolis, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Analyst, Finance

Description:
Prepare balance sheets, profit and loss statements, and other financial reports. Report organization's finances to management. Prepare data for inclusion in interim financial statements and supporting schedules. Work with Finance Manager to prepare and present the company's financial standing, maintenance of its fiscal records, and the preparation of financial reports. The position involves administrative level responsibilities in general accounting, internal auditing, cost accounting, and budgetary controls.

Major Areas of Accountability

Maintain accounts payable, accounts receivable, intercompany transactions, bank account reconciliations and credit card reconciliations.

 Prepare and reconcile Payroll related entries for both direct expense and intercompany cross charged item Reconcile payments posted on all patients’ accounts and request corrections from the “Billing and Reimbursement” department as needed. Monitor the General Ledger according to cost centers provided by Coloplast Corp. Look for discrepancies and miss-posts and revise when necessary. Maintain the company's accounting system and keep books and records on all company transactions and assets to be prepared for an audit case scenario. Partner with FP&A counterparts to ensure sufficient accrual balances versus actuals while providing recommendations to future accrual needs.  Prepare daily cash flow reporting for the Leadership Team and forecast month-end cash position to ensure sufficient cash on hand at month end for all liabilities. Prepare daily and monthly journal entries including amortization, depreciation and pre-paid entries as well as revenue and revenue adjustment entries in preparation of the month-end closing process. Prepare and update all reports needed for month-end closing within the given timeframe. During the month end process, prepare Balance Sheet reconciliation backup for all accounts and present to Senior Finance Manager for revision and endorsement. Source and post data for reports that outline the company's financial position as A/R, A/P and financial reports. Present findings to Senior Finance Manager for analysis and inclusion in financial statements. Monitor workflow in order to meet month-end/ quarterly reporting requirements, and alert manager to any issues with systems or staff which would impact the team’s ability to meet production requirements. Consolidate Sage 50 Accounting software for sister companies Comfort Medical and once month-end closing is done. Review and analyze financial practices of the company to ensure compliance with policies and procedures, federal, state and local mandates, and the company’s fiscal budgetary programs. Complete select periodic tax filings and payments as necessary. Lead and mentor Bookkeeper to assist with Accounting Department responsibilities and deliverables. Other duties as assigned.



Basic Qualifications

 BS/BA in Accounting, Finance or related major from an accredited university. 5+ years of experience in financial recordkeeping procedures, laws, regulations, and standards, knowledge of all facets of accounting and finance. Excellent Peachtree, Word, and Excel skills. Coloplast employees are required to conduct business to the highest ethical and professional standards; comply with applicable laws and regulations, the Advamed Code of Ethics on Interactions with Healthcare Professionals, and company policies.



Comfort Medical provides an extensive selection of name brand catheter and ostomy supplies to thousands of customers nationwide. Our attention to detail, unmatched customer service, and dedication to helping our customers live happier, healthier lives are just a few of the many reasons we are one of the fastest growing catheter and ostomy supply companies in the nation!

Comfort Medical employees are required to conduct business to the highest ethical and professional standards; comply with applicable laws and regulations, the Advamed Code of Ethics on Interactions with Healthcare Professionals, and company policies.

Comfort Medical is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) which means we employ and promote individuals based on their merits, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, status with regards to public assistance or any other protected classification.

56591

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
